__TOC__

* Contact: Daniel477
* Model: Samsung Q70
* Website: http://notebook.samsung.de/article.asp?artid=83E061FC-C399-44FC-A8DB-39E58AF05478

== Current Issues ==

Tested with 7.10 Gutsy, kernel: 2.6.22-14-generic #1 SMP

Needs some polishing, see the notes section, after that most things work, except...
* Problems setting the backlight-brightness (see notes)
* Problems with the WLAN, it does not find essids, not clearly locatable  
* The hardware volume switch does not work (but software does)

== System Info ==

There are different Models of the Q70, as fare as I can see, the differ only concerning the processor speed, the tested one is DEVON 
* DURY Intel Core 2 Duo Processor T7500 (2.20GHz/4MB/800FSB)
* DEVON Intel Core 2 Duo Processor T7300 (2.00GHz/4MB/800FSB)

Common:
* 13.3" WXGA Super Bright Glare TFT, max. Resolution 1280x800
* 2048 MB DDR2-RAM 
* 200 GB SATA Harddisk 4200rpm 
* 128 MB Turbo Cache Nvidia Geforce 8400M G 
* DVD+-R/+-RW Double Layer
* WLAN (a/b/g/n) Intel 
* Bluetooth 2.0

== Notes ==

=== Audio ===

The mixer (kmix) gets much more settings and the internal speakers mute when plugging a head phone, if you give the audio driver a hint concerning the model of your notebook: add the following line "options snd-hda-intel model=basic" to the file "/etc/modprobe.d/options‚Äù and restart (changing the option on a running system is possible but much more complicated). Maybe there is a even better option, but with this one, it works.

=== Wireless ===

Currently only the manual configuration works, no nm, no wicd, no wlassistent. It does not recognize the essid, it does not connect
 
=== Card Reader ===

To use sd-cards with the build-in card reader, add the following lines to the file "/etc/modules" <pre>
   tifm_sd
   tifm_7xx1
   tifm_core</pre>

Driver homepage: xd cards are not working yet, http://tifmxx.berlios.de/
